abstract.para: This document demonstrates how to install/update CppAD for SPK that is different from the procedure given by the author of the package. Our procedure enables us to treat CppAD as part of SPK so that it is installed into our test environment first.

The information in this document is targeted primarily towards the RFPK Software Team and associates and is specific to the computer systems and network installed in the RFPK Laboratory of the &dept; of the &uw;. RFPK is the Resource for Population Kinetics. Its work is supported, in part, by grant P41 EB-001975 of the National Institutes of Health (NIH) of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.

sect1.title: Installation (specific to SPK)
sect1.para:
If we follow the original author's installation procedure, CppAD is installed in the following directories:
headers - $PREFIX/include/CppAD/ libraries - $PREFIX/lib/
$PREFIX is an arbitrary path.

On the other hand, SPK components installation requires the following directory structures:
headers - $PREFIX/include/$INST_ENV/CppAD/ libraries - $PREFIX/lib/$INST_ENV/
$INST_ENV is either "spktest" for the test environment or "spkprod" for the production environment.

We like to install CppAD just like other SPK components so that we can test fully under the test environment and move it to the production when it is really ready. To do that, we ignore the author's installation procedure and follow the procedure below:

listitem.para:
Download a copy of CppAD (CppAD.unix.tar.gz) from
http://www.seanet.com/~bradbell into /tmp on the installation machine.

Unpack the downloaded package:
cd /tmp tar xvzf CppAD.unix.tar.gz
This will extract files into a new directory whose name begins with "cppad" followed by a release date/version. We denote it as "cppadXXX" for the rest of the document.

Create Makefiles tuned to the installation machine:
cd cppadXXX ./configure

We copy the headers along with its containing directory into /usr/local/include/spktest/:
su cp -r CppAD /usr/local/include/spktest/CppAD

Finally copy the library, libCppAD.a, to /usr/local/lib/spktest/:
cp lib/lib* /usr/local/lib/spktest/
